[[2011â12 Mersin Ä°dmanyurdu season|2011â12]] |} '''Mersin Ä°dmanyurdu''' (also ''Mersin Ä°dman Yurdu'', ''Mersin Ä°Y'', or ''MÄ°Y'') Sports Club; located in [[Mersin]], east [[Mediterranean Region, Turkey|Mediterranean]] coast of [[Turkey]] in [[2010]]-[[2011|11]]. The [[2010â11 TFF First League|2010â11]] season was the 6th season of [[Mersin Ä°dmanyurdu]] [[association football|football]] team in [[TFF First League]], the second level division in [[Turkey]] since 2001-02. MÄ°Y has taken place 33rd time in the second level football division since its foundation in 1963-64. [[Mersin Ä°dmanyurdu]] football team has finished [[2009â10 TFF First League|2009â10]] season in 13th place in [[TFF First League]]. The team was guaranteed non-relegation only at the last match of the season. Therefore president Ali KahramanlÄ± declared an extraordinary general meeting, in order to provide support for the club. However later he renounced that meeting will be held during the half-season due to lack of time to prepare team for next season.[http://www.ajansspor.com/futbol/tff1lig/h/20100530/Genel_kurula_gitmeden_devam_edecegiz.html ''Genel kurula gitmeden devam edeceÄiz'] President of the club renounces extraordinary general meeting. 30.05.2010 {{tr icon}} At the end of the season the team finished the league at first place and promoted to [[2011â12 SÃ¼per Lig|SporâToto Super League]] after 28 seasons. The winners and runners-up were promoted to [[2011â12 SÃ¼per Lig]]. The third team to be promoted was determined through promotion play-off games. Bottom two teams were relegated to [[2011â12 TFF Second League]]. On September 13, Monday, manager YÃ¼ksel YeÅilova was repeatedly stabbed by his brother, during Samsunspor-Mersin Ä°dmanyurdu match. . For that reason the match was postponed and completed on November 3. On September 26, Sunday, stopper Mustafa AydÄ±n had a wreck due to adverse weather conditions. His fiancee died in the accident he was injured and being cured since. On October 22, new coach [[Nurullah SaÄlam]] signed a 1,5 years contract.
